import React, { useState } from "react"; import { Button, Form, FormGroup, Label, Input, Alert, Col, Row, CustomInput, // InputGroup, // InputGroupAddon, FormText, } from "reactstrap"; import ThumbnailImage from "components/cards/ThumbnailImage"; import { AvField, AvForm, AvInput } from "availity-reactstrap-validation"; const AboutYou = ({ onNextStep }) => { const [selectedFile, setSelectedFile] = useState(null); const handleFileChange = (event) => { const file = event.target.files[0]; if (file) { const reader = new FileReader(); reader.onloadend = () => { setSelectedFile(reader.result); }; reader.readAsDataURL(file); } }; return (
Lovely to see you!
Filling out the form only takes a couple of minutes. We'd love to learn more about your background and the ins-and-outs of why you'd like to become a mentor. Keep things personal and talk directly to us and your mentees. We don't need jargon and polished cover letters here!

You agree to our code of conduct and the mentor agreement by sending the form, so be sure to have a look at those. {/* */} {/* */} {/* */} {/* */} {/* */} {/* */} {/* */} {/* */} {/* */} {/* */} {/* */} {/* */} {/* */}
); }; const Profile = ({ onNextStep, onPreStep }) => { return (
{/* */} {/* */} Describe your expertise to connect with mentees who have similar interests.
Comma-separated list of your skills (keep it below 10). Mentees will use this to find you. {/* */} {/* Please enter some details! */} Tell us (and your mentees) a little bit about yourself. Talk about yourself in the first person, as if you'd directly talk to a mentee. This will be public. {/* */} {/* */} Omit the “@” -e.g. “dqmonn” {/* */} You can add your blog, GitHub profile or similar here

Almost there!
You're just one last step away from being a mentor and connecting with mentees all over the world! in this step, shows off your accomplishments and how you can help others.

Many of these fields are optional, but will help us get better insights into your work - and therefore exponentially increase your chances. They also give you a jumpstart once you're a mentor. Add a youTube video or record a Loom for your future mentees Link an interview / podcast /piece of writing you are proud of or were featured in.
); }; const Mylogin = () => { const [step, setStep] = useState(1); const handleNextStep = () => { setStep(step + 1); }; const handlePreviousStep = () => { setStep(step - 1); }; return (
